title: Butterflies and Moths
description: Butterflies and Moths outlines the difference between butterflies and moths. Students learn about the body parts, life cycle, and behavior of each type of insect. Photographs and charts complement the learning experience.
highFrequencyWords: antennae, caterpillars, chrysalis, cocoon, exoskeleton, insects, invertebrates, larval, life cycle, metamorphosis, migrate, molting, predators, pupal, species
reviewWords: Use of vocabulary lessons requires a subscription to VocabularyA-Z.com.
comprehension: Antonyms                : Identify antonyms for content vocabulary
awareness: Alphabetical Order                : Alphabetize and define content vocabulary
phonics:
Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
